thread.title: S. Korea's venture investment up 40 percent in H1
thread.title_full: S. Korea's venture investment up 40 percent in H1 | MENAFN.COM

title: S. Korea's venture investment up 40 percent in H1
text:
(MENAFN) Data showed that investment in South Korean venture firms surged around 40 percent in the first six months of the year due to government support measures, Yonhap News reported.

A total of 517 venture startups received a combined USD816.1 million in investment in the January-June period, up 38.4 percent from USD589.45 million tallied the previous year, according to SMBA data. 

Out of the total, around USD221.72 million was invested in software, mobile and IT in the first half, with nearly USD133.88 million spent in e-commerce and wholesale-related firms.

The stake of the investment in venture companies that are less than 7 years old increased to 56.7 percent from 49.1 percent in the last 12 months, reflecting that investors have begun to show interest in fresh startups.
